pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data analysis and manipulation tool,
built on top of the Python programming language.




```{python}
import sys
print(sys.version)
```

```{python}

import pandas as pd
print('pandas version', pd.__version__)
```

## Reading from parquet

```{python}
big_df = pd.read_parquet("data/Combined_Flights_2022.parquet")

df=big_df.head(10)
```


## get first 3 rows
```{python}
df.head(3)
```

## get last 3 rows
```{python}
df.tail(3)
```

## get ramdon 5 rows

```{python}
df.sample(5, random_state=42)
```


## get columns names
```{python}
df.columns
```

## get row index
```{python}
df.index
```

## get long info 

```{python}
df.shape
```


```{python}
df.info()
```



## get short info 
```{python}
df.info(verbose=False)
```


## summary of numeric column
```{python}
df.describe()
```


## summary of categorical column
```{python}
df[["Airline"]].describe()
```


# select column

## select column by column names
```{python}
df[['FlightDate','Airline']]
```
## first 3 columns
```{python}
df[df.columns[:3]]
```
## last 3 columns
```{python}
df[df.columns[-3:]]
```


## select 3rd columns
```{python}
df.iloc[:,2]
```


## select int data type column

```{python}
df.select_dtypes('int')
```

# select cells


## select 3 rows and 4 column cells
```{python}
df.iloc[2, 3]
```

## select first 5 rows and first 5 column cells
```{python}
df.iloc[:5, :5] 
```
## select 3rd rows
```{python}
df.iloc[[2]]
```
